alert.note: Alert for Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 22 at 4:14AM EST until December 24 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Up to 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the beaches, Albemarle, Croatan, and Roanoke Sounds, Kitty Hawk Bay, and adjacent tidal creeks. * WHEN...From Friday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Oregon Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.4 ft, Moderate 3.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 21/05 PM 0.9 0.3 0.6 1 None 22/07 AM 1.4 0.8 0.7 1-2 None 22/07 PM 1.8 1.2 1.4 2-3 None 23/02 PM 3.3 2.7 3.3 3-4 Minor 24/08 AM 2.5 1.9 1.8 2-3 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
